body_html:
@bstriner Updating to vc 14.1 is not needed now. It is a wrong behaviour of conda-build.The usage of the flags MSSdk and DISTUTILS_USE_SDK can skip compiler check and thus build packages for Python 2.7 or.3. So it is not so essential as you said. As for VS2008, forget about it, we.are using C++11.
The second point seems incorrect too. If you look into the implementation of distutils, it just find the cl.exe executable for you, but there are no builtin compilers. You can see the detailed description from the WindowsCompiler page of Python.

The second point seems incorrect too. If you look into the implementation of distutils, it just find the cl.exe executable for you, but there are no builtin compilers. You can see the detailed description from the WindowsCompiler page of Python.
body:
@bstriner Updating to vc 14.1 is not needed now. It is a wrong behaviour of conda-build.The usage of the flags MSSdk and DISTUTILS_USE_SDK can skip compiler check and thus build packages for Python 2.7 or.3. So it is not so essential as you said. As for VS2008, forget about it, we.are using C++11.
The second point seems incorrect too. If you look into the implementation of distutils, it just find the cl.exe executable for you, but there are no builtin compilers. You can see the detailed description from the WindowsCompiler page of Python.
